explanation: The sieve inner loop started marking multiples at i*2. While that still marks composites, it is both inefficient and nonstandard: every composite smaller than i*i already has a smaller prime factor and therefore has been marked earlier. Starting at i*i avoids redundant work and is the correct starting point for the Sieve of Eratosthenes. I fixed the single incorrect line by changing the inner loop start from i*2 to i*i.
